intro: Cullen plicatum, commonly known as the pleated cullen, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes and beans. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, pleated leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Cullen plicatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with full sun.
